We choose Gong bao flavour frog porridge
and order 1 small baby kailan for sides.

I love that the porridge is thick and still can taste the rice texture.
The porridge is still thick despite we eating super slow, haha! It didn't turn watery.

The main - gong bao sauce with 3 frogs.
The sauce is not salty at all, but it is still very flavourful! It's not very spicy and you can choose a different level of spiciness!
Perfect if you have young kids! The frog meat is tender and has no fishy taste. There is an extra spicy level if you want to try!
The sauce selection: frog with spring onion, with dried chilli, with dried chilli extra spicy.

Some other unique flavour: salt and pepper, salted egg, chicken essence!

If you don't like porridge, you can also opt for white rice!

The portion of the porridge is huge for 2 person! It's best to eat at the stall! Piping hot and shiok!!! Overall happy tummy! ğŸ˜Š

Had their frog porridge on a cool rainy day and it was the best way to keep warm. The thick porridge mixed with the fragrant sauce of the Claypot Kung Po Chilli Frog legs goes perfectly well together.

Sauce is thick, savory and full of umami with just the right amount of spice. Itâ€™s one of the best combo in my opinion but you can also opt for the non spicy choice.

Ordered an additional Sweet and Sour Fish for the kids and it was also quite crisp and delicious.

Ordered the Spring Onion and Ginger stir-fried frog & porridge both served piping hot claypotâ€¦. Very yummy and satisfying. The frog meat was tender and fresh, and the sauce was very flavourful, porridge was good and goes well with the sauce ğŸ‘quite crowded on Sunday lunch

The frog meat is tender and flavourful. Pair well with their gooey porridge! Staff is attentive when we are there. Serving time is fast too. With transparency pricing on every dish, no more sweat when comes to payment! ğŸ‘
